summary: This document is an email chain from July 13, 2020, in which a survivor of sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein reaches out to an unidentified recipient. The survivor describes being assaulted by Epstein at a New York City restaurant/club when they were barely 18 years old, mentions the possible presence of Ghislaine Maxwell and other girls, and expresses a desire to help, though they feel they lack proof. The chain includes internal discussion about acknowledging the email.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified by the email sender as the person who sexually assaulted them at a NYC restaurant/club when they were barely 18 years old.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned by the email sender as someone who 'could have been there' during the assault, recalling a 'woman' present with other men.

connections.description: The email sender recalls a 'woman' (potentially Maxwell) being present with Epstein and other men during the assault, suggesting their association at the event.
The sender is a victim of Epstein and suggests Maxwell may have been present during the assault, implicating her in the context of the abuse.

events.title: Sexual assault at NYC venue
events.description: The email sender describes being sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein when they were barely 18 years old at a New York City restaurant or club. They recall the presence of a 'woman' (potentially Ghislaine Maxwell) and numerous other 'girls'.

events.title: Survivor outreach email
events.description: A survivor of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse sends an email to an unidentified recipient, disclosing their assault and expressing a desire to help, though they feel they lack proof.

keyFacts: A survivor contacted an unidentified recipient via email on July 13, 2020, to disclose they were sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein at a NYC restaurant/club when they were barely 18.
The survivor states they were too traumatized to come forward at the time and only connected the assault to Epstein after seeing his face on the news.
The survivor recalls the possible presence of Ghislaine Maxwell (described as a 'woman') and numerous other 'girls' at the venue during the assault.
The survivor expresses a willingness to help but acknowledges they have no proof and cannot offer specific information for Maxwell's case.
The email chain includes internal discussion among recipients about acknowledging the survivor's message and being supportive.
